definition: the right to a fair trial

sentences.english: The federal courts have jurisdiction over cases arising out of Constitution.
sentences.chinese: 联邦法院对涉及联邦宪法的案件有审判权。

sentences.english: The power to hear cases is called jurisdiction.
sentences.chinese: 审理案件的权力称为审判权。

sentences.english: The power and jurisdiction rest upon the Police.
sentences.chinese: 这种审判权和力量是留给警察的。

sentences.english: Judicature refers to the judicial activity carried out in court to execute judicial power over case disputes.
sentences.chinese: 司法仅指法院行使审判权对案件纠纷进行审判的活动。

sentences.english: Exercising jurisdiction independently is precondition of judicatory justice.
sentences.chinese: 审判权的独立行使是司法公正的前提。

sentences.english: Judge is the main body to exercise judicial authority independently.
sentences.chinese: 法官是独立行使审判权的主体。

sentences.english: The objective of criminal trial connects with the right jurisdiction and the right of prosecution.
sentences.chinese: 审判对象连接审判权和公诉权，有着特殊的意义。

sentences.english: Judicial independence includes independence of courts and independence of judges.
sentences.chinese: 现行的错案追究制影响了法官独立地行使审判权。

sentences.english: Then plotting the purview of the power of Fabu and Daliyuan, separate the judicial administrative authority with the judiciary power.
sentences.chinese: 第二步是明确部院权限，将司法行政权与审判权分开。

definition: separation of powers for checks and balances
